question: What was the name of the Island Paul and other people in the ship landed safely at?
answer: Malta. Acts 28:1.

question: Quote Acts 4:11
answer: This is the stone which was rejected by you builders, but has become the chief cornerstone.

question: How old was the man that was healed at the Beautiful Gate?
answer: Over 40yrs (Acts 5:22)

question: What is the meaning of the name Barnabas?
answer: Son of Consolation (Acts 5:36)

question: How many hours interval was there between the deaths of Ananias and Sapphira his wife?
answer: About 3hrs (Acts 5:7)

question: How old was Joshua when he died?
answer: At the age of 110 years. Joshua 24:29

question: The grievous complaints laid against Paul by the Jews before Festus could not be proved. True or False.?
answer: True. Acts 23:7

question: Quote Joshua 23:8.
answer: But cleave unto the Lord your God as you have done unto this day. Joshua 23:8.

question: Why was Joshua bidding farewell and admonishing the Israelites?
answer: Because he was old and stricken in age. Joshua 23:2

question: Quote Acts 23:11.
answer: And the night following, the Lord stood by him, and said, “Be of good cheer Paul; for as thou hast testified of me in Jerusalem, so must thou bear witness also at Rome.” Acts 23:11.

question: Why did Apostle Paul made this statement, "What mean ye to weep and to break mine heart? for I am ready not to be bound only, but also to die at Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus".
answer: He was being persuaded not to go the Jerusalem because of the persecution that awaited him there. Acts 21:12

question: When Peter came to Lydda, he found a certain man named _________ which had kept his bed ___________ years and was sick of the ___________.
answer: Acts 9:33. Aeneas, eight, palsy.

question: Fill in the gaps; Now, there was at _________, a certain disciple named __________ which by interpretation is called __________.
answer: Acts 9:36. Joppa, Tabitha, Dorcas.

question: Who did Peter tarry with while he was at Joppa?
answer: Acts 9:43. He tarried with one Simon a tanner at Joppa.

question: Fill in the gaps: There was a certain man in _____________ called ________, a centurion of the band called the __________ band, a __________ man and one that feared God with all his house.
answer: Acts 10:1-2. Caesarea, Cornelius, Italian, devout.

question: According to Act 1:3, how many days did Jesus appear unto the disciples after resurrection?
answer: 40 days

question: Jesus asked the disciples to tarry in _______________ and wait for the __________________ of the father.
answer: Jerusalem, Promise (Acts 1:4)

question: Quote Acts 1:8
answer: But you shall receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you; and you shall be witnesses to me in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria and to the end of the earth.

question: At what mountain did Jesus ascend to heaven?
answer: Olivet (Acts 1: 12)

question: How many people alltogether went to the upper room?
answer: About 120. Acts1:15.

question: Why were Paul and Silas thrown into prison?
answer: They were thrown into prison because the masters of the girl saw that the hope of their gains were gone as she was healed and accused them of causing disturbance in the city and teaching customs which are not lawful. (Acts 16:19 - 21).

question: Joshua was buried in the border of his inheritance at _____?
answer: Timnath-Serah, which is in mount Ephraim, on the north side of the hill of Gaash. Joshua 24:30.

question: Acts 28:28 states expressly that salvation of God is sent unto the ____________ and they will hear it.
answer: Gentiles. Acts 28:28.

question: According to the book of Joshua, who was sent for to place a curse on the Israelites but ended up Blessing them?
answer: Balaam. Joshua 24:9-10.

question: What verse of Joshua 24 referred to God as a jealous God?
answer: Joshua 24:19.

question: Paul was on his way to __________ when he had a divine encounter with the Lord Jesus Christ?
answer: Damascus. Acts 26:12-15.

question: Mention at least two of Paul's companion according to Acts 21:4
answer: Acts20:4 And there accompanied him into Asia, Sopater of Berea; and of the Thessalonians, Aristarchus and Secundus; and Gaius of Derbe, and Timotheus; and of Asia, Tychicus and Trophimus.

question: What did Paul refer the Baptism of John to be?
answer: The baptism of Repentance Acts 19:4

question: Quote Acts 19:20
answer: Acts19:20 So mightily grew the word of God and prevailed.

question: Who did Herod the king kill and why did he proceed further to take Peter also?
answer: Acts12:2-3. James the brother of John, because he saw that it pleased the Jews.

question: The chief of the Island whose name was ____________ cautiously received and lodged Paul and others for _________ days. Fill in the gaps.
answer: Publius, Three (3). Acts 28:7.

question: __________ was referred to as an old disciple in Acts 21:16
answer: Mnason of Cyprus

question: Complete this verse, Acts 22:7 And I fell unto the ground, and heard a voice saying unto me, Saul, Saul, ________
answer: Why persecutest thou me?

question: According to Acts 22:10a, Paul's statement revealed ________.
answer: Total submission and willingness to follow the command of the Lord.

question: Complete this verse, Acts 22:15 “For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast _______&__________”.
answer: Seen and heard.

question: When the angel of the Lord released Peter from prison, where did Peter go and what were they doing there?
answer: Acts12:12. The house of Mary the mother of John whose surname was Mark, where many were gathered praying.

question: Who knew/recognized Peter’s voice as he knocked at the door of the gate and what did she do?
answer: Acts12:13-15. Rhoda, she opened not the gate for gladness, but ran in and told them that Peter stood before the gate, they said she was mad, but she affirmed that it was Peter.

question: Who did the angel of the Lord smite after making an oration, why was he smitten and what happened to him?
answer: Acts12:21-23. King Herod, because he gave not God the glory when the people shouted that it was the voice of a god and not of a man, he was eaten of worms and gave up the ghost.

question: Who did Barnabas and Saul take with them when they returned from Jerusalem and had fulfilled their ministry?
answer: Acts12:25. John whose surname was Mark.

question: In which city were some Jews envious of Paul and Silas?
answer: Thessalonica (Acts 17:1,5)

question: Paul and his company left Tyre to ______ city?
answer: Ptolemias. Acts 21:7

question: When Peter refused to eat what was in the vessel, the voice spoke to him the second time and said what?
answer: Acts10:15. What God hath cleansed, that call not thou common.

question: While Peter was preaching to Cornelius and those who were with him, what happened?
answer: Acts10:44. The Holy ghost fell on all of them which heard the word.

question: The apostles and brethren that were in Judaea heard that the gentiles had also received the word and when Peter was come up to Jerusalem, who contended with him?
answer: Acts 11:2. They that were of the circumcision contended with him.

question: After Peter finished narrating the event to the apostles and the brethren, when they heard those things, what did they do?
answer: Acts11:18. They held their peace and glorified God saying “Then hath God also to the gentiles granted repentance unto life”.

question: What were the names of the two people who believed in Paul's message in Areopagus?
answer: Dionysius the Areopagite and a woman named Damaris (Acts 17:34)

question: Who was Eleazar's father?
answer: Aaron. Joshua 24:33.

question: What was Joshua referring to as strange gods?
answer: Any other god apart from the true living God. (Engaging in idolatry) Joshua 24:20.

question: Who felt it was unreasonable to send Paul (a prisoner) to Rome, and yet unable to specify the crimes laid against him.” Who did he share his opinion with?
answer: Festus, king Agrippa. Acts 25:27.

question: Publius father was sick in bed. He was down with __________ and __________, but Paul prayed for him and he was healed. Fill in the gaps.
answer: Fever and Bloody flux (Dysentery). Acts 28:8.

question: How long did Barnabas and Saul stay in Antioch?
answer: Acts11:26. A whole year.

question: Whose house did Paul and Silas enter when they left the prison keepers’ house?
answer: They entered the house of Lydia. (ANS: 16:40)

question: What event made the keeper of the prison believe in God?
answer: The earthquake that shook the foundations of the prison, causing all the doors to open and the prisoners' bands to be loosened. (Acts 16:26,34)

question: What response did Paul and Silas’ give to the prison keeper when he asked what he must do to be saved?
answer: And they said, Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved and thy house. (Acts 16:31)

question: What was the name of the disciple that Paul met in Lystra whose mother was a Jew and his father was Greek?
answer: Timotheus (Acts 16:1)

question: According to Acts 28:31; Paul preached about the kingdom of God and taught people about the Lord Jesus Christ with all confidence and no restriction (no man forbidding him). True or False?
answer: True. Acts 28:31.
